intro: Malvastrum rusbyi, commonly known as the Rusby's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers range in color from white to pink, often blooming in summer. Malvastrum rusbyi is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
